location: Red Lodge, Beartooth Highway & Chief Joseph Scenic Byway

subsections.title: Red Lodge Overview
highlights: Historic mountain town with Western charm
Gateway to Beartooth Highway
Known for its ski hill, summer events, and downtown

subsections.title: Skiing: Red Lodge Mountain
highlights: Pricing: $60–$85/day
Terrain: Groomers, tree runs, expert chutes
Vibe: Family-friendly, uncrowded, no frills
Great local hill for beginners to advanced skiers

subsections.title: Dining & Breweries
highlights: Red Lodge Pizza Co – family spot with local beers
Carbon County Steakhouse – high-end Western steakhouse
Prerogative Kitchen – modern seasonal plates
Red Lodge Ales Brewing – local brews and pub fare

subsections.title: Lodging & Campgrounds
highlights: Lupine Inn – basic accommodations near downtown
Rock Creek Resort – scenic setting outside town
KOA Red Lodge – cabins, RV, and tent camping
Cascade and Greenough Lake Campgrounds – forest sites near Beartooth start

subsections.title: Beartooth Highway Highlights
highlights: US Highway 212 – 'the most beautiful drive in America'
66 miles of alpine switchbacks, peaks, and lakes
Elevation: 10,947 feet at Beartooth Pass
Open late May to early October (weather-dependent)

subsections.title: Beartooth Hiking & Views
highlights: Top of the World Trail – alpine meadows and lakes
Beartooth Lake – easy stroll with picnic access
Clay Butte Lookout – historic fire tower views
Island Lake Trail – family-friendly alpine hike

subsections.title: Chief Joseph Scenic Byway
highlights: WY-296 connecting Beartooth Highway to Cody
Panoramic valleys, switchbacks, and wildflowers
Dead Indian Pass – stunning viewpoint with history
Great wildlife spotting area: bighorn sheep, elk

subsections.title: Campgrounds & Picnic Areas (Highways)
highlights: Beartooth Lake Campground – first-come, no hookups
Crazy Creek Campground – tent and trailer access
Island Lake Campground – popular with anglers
Pilot Creek and Fox Creek Campgrounds – quieter options

subsections.title: Local Events & Festivals
highlights: Red Lodge Music Festival (June)
Home of Champions Rodeo (July)
Beartooth Rally (motorcycle event, July)
Christmas Stroll (winter kickoff in December)

subsections.title: Loop Integration & Travel Tips
highlights: Ideal loop: Red Lodge → Beartooth → Chief Joseph → Cody
Refuel before leaving Red Lodge (no gas until Cooke City)
Travel early to avoid RV traffic
Combine with Yellowstone Northeast Entrance itinerary
